name: 陳岡伯
objective:
西方文化的交流是建立在故事上的。即使這些故事相當久遠，但每個人卻都非常熟悉，又或者是因為這些故事相當久遠，所以每個人都非常熟悉。本課程將探討近代主要西方作家作品中的核心主題及文化的意象。研讀這些近代西方主要作家的作品是發展西方文學素養及思想的基石，同時，也為任何概括了以西方文化為主體的研究提供了不可或缺的背景知識。
Conversation in Western culture is built on stories. Everybody knows the stories even though the stories are very old, or rather everybody knows them because they are very old stories. This course introduces students to some of the stories that have been most influential in the English-speaking world. Knowing these stories provides essential background knowledge for understanding Western culture in general.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to the course, the concepts of narrative & criticism

Weeks 2-4: Greek mythology & adaptations 
               Homer's The Iliad & Wolfgang Petersen's Troy (2006)

Weeks 5-7: Shakespeare's plays & adaptations
               Shakespeare's Macbeth & Akira Kurosawa's Throne of Blood (1957)

Weeks 8-10: Literature, the Bible, and popular culture
                Genesis, the Book of Job, Milton's Paradise Lost, Taylor Hackford's 
                The Devil's Advocate (1997)

Weeks 11-13: The Age of Revolution, libertinism, gender and sexuality
                 Marquis de Sade's The Misfortunes of Virtue &  Philip Kaufman's 
                 Quills (2000)   

Weeks 14-16: Colonialism, storytelling and contemporary politics
                 Conrad's "An Outpost of Progress" & Francis Coppola's Apocalypse 
                 Now (1979)

Weeks 17 & 18: Mock conference
